channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Israel-Hezbollah clash: Another UN peacekeeper injured amid escalating conflict
item.description: Hezbollah engaged Israeli forces in southern Lebanon as Israeli strikes hit UNIFIL bases, injuring peacekeepers. U.N. Secretary-General and Western countries condemned the attacks. Israeli assaults on Gaza killed 29 Palestinians amid ongoing military operations. Evacuations were ordered in northern Israel and southern Lebanon as conflict escalated with significant civilian displacement and casualties.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Macao's former top judge elected as Chinese casino hub's first leader born in mainland China
item.description: Sam Hou Fai, a former top judge, has been elected as Macao's new leader in a largely ceremonial vote. He is set to become the city's first chief executive born in mainland China, marking a shift from business-driven governance to a legal professional prioritized by Beijing.

item.title: 'Path to self destruction': Nobel Peace prize winners, atomic bomb survivors, warn of nuclear threat
item.description: Leaders of Nihon Hidankyo warn of an increasing nuclear war threat and call for complete nuclear disarmament. Shigemitsu Tanaka, bomb survivor, emphasizes the deteriorating global situation amid tensions. Their plea follows receiving the Nobel Peace Prize, recognizing their anti-nuclear efforts, and is highlighted by recent statements from Russian President Vladimir Putin on nuclear options.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan prepares for SCO Summit amidst security concerns
item.description: Ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit, Pakistan gears up to secure Islamabad amid recent militant attacks and political unrest. Authorities enforce strict measures, including troop deployment and a ban on protests. Key attendees include officials from China, India, and Russia. The summit will focus on trade, humanitarian, and cultural issues, despite Pakistan's escalating domestic tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Do they want ZERO Catholic votes for Harris?': Christian officials slam governor's viral video mocking holy communion
item.description: Michigan’s Catholic leaders, including all seven diocesan bishops, criticized Governor Gretchen Whitmer for a video where she mimics administering Communion with a Dorito. They view the video as mocking the Christian sacrament and call for respect toward religious practices.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 3 nurses struck by jeep in hit-and-run while assisting gunshot victim in Philadelphia hospital
item.description: A vehicle fleeing from Penn Presbyterian Medical Center in Philadelphia struck three nurses, critically injuring one, after dropping off a gunshot victim. The 28-year-old victim suffered multiple gunshot wounds and a possible head injury. Hospital staff continued patient care despite the incident. Philadelphia police are investigating the hit-and-run and earlier shooting.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US soldier sentenced to 14 years for aiding ISIS and conspiring to murder American troops
item.description: Cole Bridges, a US army soldier, has been sentenced to 14 years for attempting to help ISIS plan attacks on American troops. Bridges provided training and guidance to purported ISIS fighters, shared Army manuals, and advised on ambushing US forces. His actions included recording supportive videos and sending attack instructions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Woman pleads guilty to smuggling 29 turtles worth $40K across US-Canada border
item.description: Wan Yee Ng admitted to trying to smuggle 29 eastern box turtles, valued over $40,000, from the US to Canada via an inflatable kayak. She faces sentencing in December after being caught in Vermont. The turtles were likely intended for sale in Hong Kong. Ng has agreed to pay for their care.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Baloch human rights activist charged with terrorism
item.description: Pakistani police filed a case against human rights activist Dr Mahrang Baloch, accusing her of aiding separatist groups in Balochistan. She was recently barred from a flight to New York. Baloch denies the allegations, claiming the state targets her due to her activism against enforced disappearances and extra-judicial killings.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq

item.title: 'We’re getting Diddy freaky tonight': Landon Barker slammed for baby oil theme at birthday party
item.description: Landon Barker is facing criticism for attending a party that mocked sexual assault accusations against Sean “Diddy” Combs. Videos from the event showed baby oil references and insensitive jokes, sparking outrage online. Diddy is under investigation for alleged abuse at his 'Freak Off' parties.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: College student discovers live scorpion in parcel
item.description: A University of Bristol student discovered a live scorpion in a package of boots from Shein. With the help of her flatmates, she captured the insect and contacted the National Centre for Reptile Welfare. Shein conducted an internal investigation, confirming their standard procedures were followed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Milton triggers EF-3 Tornado in Florida's Palm Beach County, leaving seven injured
item.description: Hurricane Milton spawned a powerful tornado in Florida's Palm Beach County, injuring seven and causing widespread damage. The tornado, which struck on Wednesday, had peak winds of 140 mph, destroyed homes, uprooted trees, and caused significant structural damage, classified as an EF-3 by the NWS.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I’m at the airport, and the creepiest...': Woman receives disturbing text from stranger
item.description: A woman named Kirsten received a disturbing text from a stranger who found her number on her luggage tag at an airport. Sharing her experience on TikTok, Kirsten emphasized the breach of privacy and advised travelers to conceal their personal info on luggage tags to prevent similar incidents.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'An aggressive, offensive play': Why is Trump campaigning in California, a Democratic stronghold?
item.description: Donald Trump's visit to California ahead of election day is strategic despite the state's Democratic lean. His presence aims to galvanize supporters, boost campaign efforts in crucial battleground states, and raise significant funds. The visit will receive extensive media coverage and could influence congressional races, potentially impacting control of the House.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Woman snatches cash from 7-year-old boy, hits mother at grocery store in viral video
item.description: In Bronx, a woman stole cash from a 7-year-old boy at Richard's Fruit and Vegetable store. She assaulted his mother before fleeing. The incident, captured on security footage, showed the woman taking around $4. The store co-owner expressed shock, noting he had previously seen the woman but never with the disguise she wore.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance dodges question on 2020 election five times, refuses to admit Biden's victory
item.description: JD Vance, US Republican vice-presidential nominee, repeatedly dodges acknowledging Joe Biden's 2020 win, emphasizing other issues like border security and affordability. This stance aligns with Donald Trump's ongoing claims of election fraud, despite multiple debunkings by officials and courts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Port of Hamburg, lifeline for the second most populated city in Germany, plans for climate protection, circular economy
item.description: Hamburg Port, Germany's largest and Europe's third-largest container port, is working towards zero emissions. Despite being a hub for industries like steel and cement, it aims to achieve climate-neutral logistics using methods such as onshore power supply and green fuels while monitoring emissions annually.
item.dc:creator: Neel Kamal

item.title: At least one dead, 12 injured in Halloween party shooting in Oklahoma City
item.description: At least one person is dead, and 12 others are injured following a shooting at a Halloween party in Oklahoma City. The incident began with an argument that escalated to gunfire. Police are investigating, and several individuals have been detained, with multiple gunmen believed to be involved. According to police, this was not a random shooting, and there is no ongoing threat to the public.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bomb survivors use Nobel Peace Prize win to share their anti-nuke message with younger generations
item.description: Nihon Hidankyo, an organization of atomic bomb survivors, won the Nobel Peace Prize for their activism against nuclear weapons. As survivors age, they are committed to passing their message to younger generations. High school students are inspired and pledging to continue the movement.

item.title: Meghan Markle's 'most bullied person in the world' remark sparks debate
item.description: Meghan Markle, during a visit to Girls Inc. of Greater Santa Barbara, spoke about her experience with online bullying, labeling herself as 'one of the most bullied people in the world.' She engaged in activities that highlighted the emotional toll of social media, while her and Prince Harry's Archewell Foundation funded Social Media U's expansion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
